verses.kjv: And it came to pass at the end of twenty years, wherein Solomon had built the house of the LORD, and his own house,
verses.web: At the end of twenty years, in which Solomon had built LORD’s house and his own house,
verses.ct: After the 20 years it took Solomon to build the LORD's temple and his own royal palace,

verses.kjv: That the cities which Huram had restored to Solomon, Solomon built them, and caused the children of Israel to dwell there.
verses.web: Solomon built the cities which Huram had given to Solomon, and caused the children of Israel to dwell there.
verses.ct: he rebuilt the cities that Huram had given him and settled Israelites in them.

verses.kjv: And Solomon went to Hamathzobah, and prevailed against it.
verses.web: Solomon went to Hamath Zobah, and prevailed against it.
verses.ct: Solomon marched against Hamath Zobah and conquered it.

verses.kjv: And he built Tadmor in the wilderness, and all the store cities, which he built in Hamath.
verses.web: He built Tadmor in the wilderness, and all the storage cities, which he built in Hamath.
verses.ct: He built Tadmor in the wilderness and all the supply cities in the region of Hamath.

verses.kjv: Also he built Bethhoron the upper, and Bethhoron the nether, fenced cities, with walls, gates, and bars;
verses.web: Also he built Beth Horon the upper and Beth Horon the lower, fortified cities, with walls, gates, and bars;
verses.ct: He also built Upper Beth Horon and Lower Beth Horon as fortified cities with walls, gates, and bars.

verses.kjv: And Baalath, and all the store cities that Solomon had, and all the chariot cities, and the cities of the horsemen, and all that Solomon desired to build in Jerusalem, and in Lebanon, and throughout all the land of his dominion.
verses.web: and Baalath, and all the storage cities that Solomon had, and all the cities for his chariots, the cities for his horsemen, and all that Solomon desired to build for his pleasure in Jerusalem, in Lebanon, and in all the land of his dominion.
verses.ct: He built Baalath and all his supply cities, along with cities for his chariots and cities for his horsemen — everything Solomon wanted to build in Jerusalem, in Lebanon, and throughout his entire kingdom.

verses.kjv: As for all the people that were left of the Hittites, and the Amorites, and the Perizzites, and the Hivites, and the Jebusites, which were not of Israel,
verses.web: As for all the people who were left of the Hittites, the Amorites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites, who were not of Israel;
verses.ct: Now there were still people left in the land from the Hittites, Amorites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites — people who were not Israelites.

verses.kjv: But of their children, who were left after them in the land, whom the children of Israel consumed not, them did Solomon make to pay tribute until this day.
verses.web: of their children who were left after them in the land, whom the children of Israel didn’t consume, of them Solomon conscripted forced labor to this day.
verses.ct: Their descendants, whom the Israelites had not wiped out, Solomon forced into labor gangs — and they remain so to this day.

verses.kjv: But of the children of Israel did Solomon make no servants for his work; but they were men of war, and chief of his captains, and captains of his chariots and horsemen.
verses.web: But of the children of Israel, Solomon made no servants for his work; but they were men of war, and chief of his captains, and rulers of his chariots and of his horsemen.
verses.ct: Solomon did not force any Israelites into slave labor. Instead, they served as his soldiers, officers, commanders, and chariot and cavalry leaders.

verses.kjv: And these were the chief of king Solomon’s officers, even two hundred and fifty, that bare rule over the people.
verses.web: These were the chief officers of king Solomon, even two-hundred fifty, who ruled over the people.
verses.ct: King Solomon had 250 chief officials who supervised the people.

verses.kjv: And Solomon brought up the daughter of Pharaoh out of the city of David unto the house that he had built for her: for he said, My wife shall not dwell in the house of David king of Israel, because the places are holy, whereunto the ark of the LORD hath come.
verses.web: Solomon brought up Pharaoh’s daughter out of David’s city to the house that he had built for her; for he said, “My wife shall not dwell in the house of David king of Israel, because the places where LORD’s ark has come are holy.”
verses.ct: Solomon moved Pharaoh's daughter from the city of David to the palace he had built for her. He said, "My wife must not live in the palace of King David of Israel, because every place the ark of the LORD has been is holy."

verses.kjv: Then Solomon offered burnt offerings unto the LORD on the altar of the LORD, which he had built before the porch,
verses.web: Then Solomon offered burnt offerings to LORD on LORD’s altar, which he had built before the porch,
verses.ct: Solomon presented burnt offerings to the LORD on the altar he had built in front of the temple porch.

verses.kjv: Even after a certain rate every day, offering according to the commandment of Moses, on the sabbaths, and on the new moons, and on the solemn feasts, three times in the year, even in the feast of unleavened bread, and in the feast of weeks, and in the feast of tabernacles.
verses.web: even as the duty of every day required, offering according to the commandment of Moses, on the Sabbaths, on the new moons, and on the set feasts, three times per year, during the feast of unleavened bread, during the feast of weeks, and during the feast of booths.
verses.ct: He offered the daily sacrifices required by the law of Moses, including those for the Sabbaths, the new moon celebrations, and the 3 annual festivals — the Festival of Unleavened Bread, the Festival of Weeks, and the Festival of Tabernacles.

verses.kjv: And he appointed, according to the order of David his father, the courses of the priests to their service, and the Levites to their charges, to praise and minister before the priests, as the duty of every day required: the porters also by their courses at every gate: for so had David the man of God commanded.
verses.web: He appointed, according to the ordinance of David his father, the divisions of the priests to their service, and the Levites to their offices, to praise and to minister before the priests, as the duty of every day required; the doorkeepers also by their divisions at every gate, for David the man of God had so commanded.
verses.ct: Following the instructions of his father David, he assigned the divisions of priests to their duties and the Levites to their roles of leading praise and assisting the priests with each day's requirements. He also stationed the gatekeepers by divisions at each gate, just as David, the man of God, had commanded.

verses.kjv: And they departed not from the commandment of the king unto the priests and Levites concerning any matter, or concerning the treasures.
verses.web: They didn’t depart from the commandment of the king to the priests and Levites concerning any matter, or concerning the treasures.
verses.ct: No one deviated from the king's instructions to the priests and Levites on any matter, including the management of the treasuries.

verses.kjv: Now all the work of Solomon was prepared unto the day of the foundation of the house of the LORD, and until it was finished. So the house of the LORD was perfected.
verses.web: Now all the work of Solomon was prepared from the day of the foundation of LORD’s house until it was finished. So LORD’s house was completed.
verses.ct: All of Solomon's work was carried out from the day the foundation of the LORD's temple was laid until it was finished. The LORD's temple was complete.

verses.kjv: Then went Solomon to Eziongeber, and to Eloth, at the sea side in the land of Edom.
verses.web: Then Solomon went to Ezion Geber and to Eloth, on the seashore in the land of Edom.
verses.ct: Solomon then traveled to Ezion Geber and Eloth on the coast in the land of Edom.

verses.kjv: And Huram sent him by the hands of his servants ships, and servants that had knowledge of the sea; and they went with the servants of Solomon to Ophir, and took thence four hundred and fifty talents of gold, and brought them to king Solomon.
verses.web: Huram sent him ships and servants who had knowledge of the sea by the hands of his servants; and they came with the servants of Solomon to Ophir, and brought from there four hundred fifty talents of gold, and brought them to king Solomon.
verses.ct: Huram sent him ships along with experienced sailors. These men sailed with Solomon's servants to Ophir, where they brought back 450 talents of gold and delivered it to King Solomon.
